body.p: The Interpretations Committee observed that there could be two ways of identifying ‘the transaction’ for the purpose of determining the exchange rate to use on initial recognition:

li.p: the ‘one-transaction’ approach—the receipt or payment of consideration and the transfer of the goods or services are all considered to be part of the same transaction. Thus, the date of the transaction is determined by the date on which the first element of the transaction qualifies for recognition applying the relevant Standards.

the ‘multi-transaction’ approach—the receipt or payment of consideration and the transfer of the goods or services are considered to be separate transactions, each of which has its own ‘date of the transaction’ when it first qualifies for recognition applying the relevant Standards.
